intro: Holoschoenus globulifer, commonly known as the globular sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like appearance with cylindrical stems and small, clustered flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its reproductive structures are enclosed within spikelets, which contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Holoschoenus globulifer plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
